messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Im new to unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: My kids LOVE playing pretend at 7 and 4 and I am always looking for the plush toys they like to play with. This week I got them ( from e-bay) 7 of the Sonic
messages.messageBody:
My kids LOVE playing pretend at 7 and 4 and I am always looking for the plush toys they like to play with.
This week I got them ( from e-bay) 7 of the Sonic the Hedgehog toys.
We also have Super Mario, Luigui and some other characters and also a bunch of Pikmin.
I record Saturday mornings Sonic cartoons and  find Mario cartoons for them.
Gigi has many dress up clothes , mostly presents or thrift store buys for very little.
Do you helpo them find great pretend play props and scenarios?
We gave MD a video camera for making movies with his toys that he uploads to his YouTube channel and he also loves binders and paper to draw stories and make books.

 
Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Im new to unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: I m just wondering if you all have any advice for a newbie unschooling mommy of 2 .. I have a 6 yr old art loving daughter and 5 yr old little boy who loves to
messages.messageBody:
I'm just wondering if you all have any advice for a newbie unschooling mommy of 2 .. I have a 6 yr old art loving daughter and 5 yr old little boy who loves to pretend.

here is a little back round: For a 2 month period we put my daughter in to school Kindergarten just to see .. ALL I saw a big mistake and pulled her out ASAP. so from NOV 09 until know we have been on the adventure of unschooling. but i feel a little lost.

so I would love some advice or thoughts .. thanks for your time :)

Holley
